title: Commercial Documents Evidence Act, 1939
description: Official consolidated text of Commercial Documents Evidence Act, 1939 (XXX of 1939) published by The Pakistan Code (Law of Evidence).

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title and extent
provisions.content:
(1) This Act may be called the Commercial Documents Evidence
Act, 1939.
1
[(2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan.]

provisions.title: Section 2. Statements of relevant facts in scheduled documents to be themselves relevant facts
provisions.content:
Notwithstanding anything contained in the Evidence Act, 1872 (I of 1872), statements of facts in
issue or of relevant facts made in any document included in the Schedule as to matters usually stated
in such document shall be themselves relevant facts within the meaning of that Act.

provisions.title: Section 3. Presumption as to genuineness of documents. For the purposes of the Evidence Act,
provisions.content:
1872 (I of 1872), and notwithstanding anything contained therein, a Court __
(a)        shall presume, within the meaning of that Act, in relation to documents
included in Part I of the Schedule, and
(b)        may presume, within the meaning of that Act, in relation to documents
included in Part II of the Schedule,__
that any document purporting to be a document included in Part I or Part II of the Schedule, as the
case may be, and to have been duly made by or under the appropriate authority, was so made and
that the statements contained therein are accurate.

provisions.title: Section 4. Definition. In the Schedule the expression “recognised Chamber of Commerce” means a
provisions.content:
Chamber of Commerce recognised by the Government of its country as being competent to issue
certificates of origin, and includes any other association similarly recognised.
2
